text: My favorite section of an amazing game.
author: Joshua Fagan

text: Oh man what a teaser from Nintendo with the new Zelda! I'm seriously considering getting a Wii U to play it. That open-world aspect the game will have has got me so pumped up about it!!! That arrow at the end looked so.. I don't know "modern or advanced"? Maybe this Zelda game will have lots of technology? The wait for Zelda games are always so long but worth it, cannot wait till next year. Can you guys mention some Wii U games you have been playing a lot? it will help me with the decision to get one. Thank you in advance and thank you Supra for always sharing your amazing tastes for soundtracks!
author: LightyGab

text: I have been playing Mario 3d world, Mario kart 8, and will be playing tons of smash bros when that comes out.
author: Hunter Davis

text: @Hunter Davis Thanks man. I think I'll get one when Zelda comes out.
author: LightyGab

text: @pikminlover72 So I've heard! but to be honest, those games don't call my attention at the moment. Maybe if I borrow them from a friend I would play it but not buy it. Zelda and Xenoblade Chronicles X are my main reasons to get the Wii U right now, hopefully we get to see more games released in the coming months.
author: LightyGab

text: This was my favorite dungeon simply because of the somewhat unsettling atmosphere you feel when you walk through it...the eerie music creates that tone for when these are just old, dusty ruins, and even for this hi-tech stage. The premise was brilliant, the dungeon itself was enjoyable, and...this is my favorite Zelda game! (For now, maybe.)
author: The Real Sean W. Stewart

text: Why are some people so sure that the character in the E3 Zelda trailer is not Link? It's so obviously him. He does look a bit feminine, but that might the angle they're going for in his design for this game.
author: Medal Melodies

text: as you said, because he looks feminine... too feminine. however, they just confirmed, that is indeed link
author: AdlerSchwadron

text: one of the most stupid games in the world ;]
author: Marian Panayotov

text:
Would love to play Skyward Sword, but i really couldnt handle the motion controls. 
Have always had that problem, probably how i have it set up in my room. :P
author: Redfoxe

text:
Yeah me too. The motion plus is really annoying when it constantly disconects...
motion plus = motion minus.....
author: Donut Rain

text: Wowzers this music is awesome.
author: Ryeguy123a

text:
I... still have to play this game.  It's been sitting on my desk for a couple of months now. 

Please don't hurt me.
author: Rusa

text: Great song!
author: DuELm

text: I hope this new Zelda game is really open-world since i loved how open the world was in Wind Waker.  I'm excited for that game.  However, the game I am most looking forward to playing anytime soon is going to be Shovel Knight for the 3DS.  That game looks absolutely awesome.
author: Eric C.

text:
I just got to this area for the first time in the game and this morning thought "This would make a good Supradarky Upload".

Get out of my head! :D
author: TheJrc80

text: The new Zelda looks great, but i'm afraid the story will be miniscule because of how the world looks to be set up.
author: NetConsole

text: Personally I don't think worrying much about story in a Zelda game is a great idea, but to each his (or her) own.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: Why not?
author: NetConsole

text: I never find that they're much to really write home about.  Always good enough to support the game, and not much better.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: I disagree, Link's Awakening, Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks, and every 3D game has its moments story wise, especially Majora's Mask!
author: NetConsole

text: I'm not disagreeing on that!  I'd just rather the gameplay take center stage.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: I agree with that, but they should not forget about having a solid story.
author: NetConsole

text: I just had to upload something Zelda related after the newest announcement. It was a short teaser, but it was enough to give me chills, especially that first shot with the big open field. The sense of adventure I loved in Wind Waker should be back and better than ever. And you know what? I have a feeling it wasn't actually Link in that trailer!
author: SupraDarky

text: They just left it for open interpretation. Strongest evidence is that he wasn't left handed, but that just leaves the question of who he actually was.
author: Hawlo

text: @Hawelo92 well in skyward sword and in twilight princess for the wii he was right-handed because of the motion controls so I really don't see this as being an indicator to the person not being link.
author: gangwolfgamer

text: the character riding the horse looked very female to me
author: Iwannaplayssbb

text: its gonna be twins. First one to call it!
author: Hatt Hanz

text: Its definitely Zelda. Can't believe its coming out next year!
author: Mr. Horseshoe

text: He looks like a guy, though.
author: Hawlo

text: you don't fear the copyright claim? triforce of courage will do you no good without the other two :)
author: Big Ben Four

text: The creator of the game Eiji Aonuma has confirmed that the character shown may not be Link at all in an interview, so yep.
author: wongdor

text: I'm hoping it's Aryll (or a reincarnation) personally. Looks so much like Link, but a girl. So it's his sister!
author: wongdor

text: @Rodrigo Pacheco That'd be cool. 2 characters at all would be sweet honestly. :P
author: Austin L

text:

text: Sorry to disappoint, but it was Link. He does look more like a woman, though... Does that mean Link will be female in this game? That would be awesome.

text: @Alfonso ST I guess he's just a pretty boy, as usual.

text: You picked my favorite Skyward Sword song. It invokes a feeling of desolation but still adds a feeling of urgency.
